title: Résumé
description: An online version of my résumé. Easily printable!.

experience.responsibilities: I worked in a bakery, waking up early to decorate donuts and bake bread, amongst other goods.
We've completed two independent tours across 11 states. I design, develop, and maintain our website; built with Eleventy and hosted on Netlify via git.
I was responsible for cataloging our inventory of content and creative works to help the team quickly find assets.

I managed the email channel, driving conversions and engagement. I designed and built mobile-responsive email templates, automated workflows, managed lists, and improved our HubSpot deliverability score from a 1 to a 67 (avg. score = 50), greatly improving channel effectiveness. I headed SEO, including maintaining our keyword database and Moz Pro reporting.

I conducted technical reviews for web-based products and promotions, ensuring best practices in performance and accessibility. I monitored the health of our domains, acting on any blacklisting reports and working with the marketing team to address compliance issues on the part of our affiliates. I stayed up to date on the latest developments in the industry, helping my teams stay informed on upcoming changes or optimization opportunities.

I managed a WordPress multisite network for the arts department, designing and developing sites, PHP templates, and child themes to meet the needs of the department. Students and staff contribute to the site, so I kept structured documentation in order for everyone to be able to complete their work as needed.

I developed web components for the Beacon Design System, working closely with the design team to implement components according to the design specifications. I assisted teams consuming the web components in their application at all stages of the adoption process. Notable projects include creating the architecture for components such as Tables, Data Visualization, architecting the Beacon CSS utility framework, refactoring our Style Dictionary build to support modern and cross platform design tokens, and devising a deprecation strategy for component properties and style tokens when structural changes impact those initial implementations.

I serve as the Tech Lead for the Beacon Web Team. I continue to develop components for the Beacon Design System while also helping to shape the future of the system through assisting with the project roadmap and guiding the team along in defining a strong set of patterns that help make our components the best they can be for our users.

interests.blurb: When I'm not writing code, I'm either writing music or learning about literally anything new.
